TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class PagedDataSource : System.Collections.ICollection, System.ComponentModel.ITypedList

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PagedDataSource extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable, class System.ComponentModel.ITypedList

Docs.summary: Encapsulates the paging-related properties of a data-bound control (such as , , , and ) that allow it to perform paging. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The PagedDataSource class encapsulates the properties that allow data-source controls, such as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>, to perform paging. This class is used by control developers when providing paging support to a custom data-bound control.
This class uses the best available method to enumerate over the data belonging to the current page. If the underlying data source supports indexed access (such as <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Collections.IList?displayProperty=fullName>), this class uses it. Otherwise, it uses the enumerator created by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable.GetEnumerator%2A> method.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of PagedDataSource, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.%23ctor%2A> constructor.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource> class.
The following table shows initial property values for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowCustomPaging%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowPaging%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging%2A>|`false`| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.CurrentPageIndex%2A>|0| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.PageSize%2A>|10| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.VirtualCount%2A>|0|

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether custom paging is enabled in a data-bound control.
Docs.value: if custom paging is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the AllowCustomPaging property to indicate whether custom paging is enabled. Custom paging is an optional type of paging provided specifically by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound control (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>) uses server-side paging and does not support custom paging. Custom paging and server-side paging are mutually exclusive. If you set AllowCustomPaging to `true`, be sure that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging%2A> is set to `false`.
For more information about custom paging, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowCustomPaging%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether paging is enabled in a data-bound control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the AllowPaging property to specify whether a data-bound control has paging enabled. ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>) also use server-side paging to provide automatic paging functionality. For more information on server-side paging, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging%2A>. When using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, you can also provide your own custom paging logic. For more information on custom paging, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.AllowCustomPaging%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowCustomPaging%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
For more information about paging support for data-bound controls, see the `AllowPaging` property of the data-bound control.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether server-side paging is enabled.
Docs.value: if server-side paging is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET version 2.0 data-bound controls (such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.GridView>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView>) provide automatic paging functionality through server-side paging. When using an ASP.NET 2.0 data-bound control, set this property to `true`.
> [!NOTE] > Server-side paging and custom paging are mutually exclusive. If you set AllowServerPaging to `true`, be sure that <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowCustomPaging%2A> is set to `false`.

MemberSignature.Value: public void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: A zero-based <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> that receives the copied items from the data source.
The first position in the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> to receive the copied contents.
Docs.summary: Copies all the items from the data source to the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index in the <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this method to copy the contents of the data source into the specified <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName>, starting at the specified index. The <xref:System.Array?displayProperty=fullName> is often used to iterate through the items in the data source.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items to be used from the data source.
Docs.value: The number of items to be used from the data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the Count property to determine the number of items to be used from the data source. The value returned depends on whether paging is enabled and whether custom paging is used.
- If paging is disabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> property to `false`), the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSourceCount%2A> property is returned.
- If paging is enabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> property to `true`) and custom paging is enabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsCustomPagingEnabled%2A> property set to `true`), the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.PageSize%2A> property is returned.
- If paging is enabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> property to `true`) and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsLastPage%2A> property is set to `false`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.PageSize%2A> property is returned.
- If paging is enabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> property to `true`), custom paging is disabled (by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsCustomPagingEnabled%2A> property `false`), and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsLastPage%2A> property is set to `true`, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSourceCount%2A> property is subtracted from the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.FirstIndexInPage%2A> property before it is returned.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSource%2A> property contains `null`, 0 is returned.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the index of the current page.
Docs.value: The index of the current page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the CurrentPageIndex property to specify or determine the index of the current page.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data source.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that represents the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the DataSource property to specify or determine the data source being paged.

Docs.summary: Gets the number of items in the data source.
Docs.value: The number of items in the data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DataSourceCount property to determine the number of items in the data source. If custom paging or server-side paging is used, the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.VirtualCount%2A> property is returned; otherwise, the total number of items in the data source is returned.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSource%2A> property contains `null`, 0 is returned.

Docs.exception: The data source is not an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object.

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the first record displayed on the page.
Docs.value: The index of the first record displayed on the page.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the FirstIndexInPage property to determine the index of the first item on the current page.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> property is set to `false`, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsCustomPagingEnabled%2A> or <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging%2A> properties are set to `true`, or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSource%2A> property contains `null`, 0 is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all items in the data source.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object that contains all items in the data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to create a <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator?displayProperty=fullName> that can be iterated through to get each item in the data source. To access the item at the current position in the enumerator, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property. Use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move to the next item in the collection. To move the enumerator to its initial position, use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
> [!NOTE] > When you initially get the enumerator or use the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Reset%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to move the enumerator to the first item in the collection, you must call the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.MoveNext%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method. Otherwise, the item represented by the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator.Current%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is undefined.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection GetItemProperties(class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor[] listAccessors) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects that contains the list name returned. This can be .
Docs.summary: Returns the that represents the properties on each item used to bind data.
Docs.returns: The that represents the properties on each item used to bind data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the GetItemProperties method to create a <xref:System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptorCollection?displayProperty=fullName> that represents the properties on each item used to bind data. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSource%2A> property is `null` or is not a <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypedList?displayProperty=fullName> implemented object, `null` is returned. For more information on the GetItemProperties method, see <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypedList.GetItemProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance string GetListName(class System.ComponentModel.PropertyDescriptor[] listAccessors) cil managed

Docs.param: An array of objects that contains the list name returned. This can be .
Docs.summary: Returns the name of the list. This method does not apply to this class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is inherited from <xref:System.ComponentModel.ITypedList?displayProperty=fullName> and is not applicable to this class. It has been implemented to return <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> for all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether custom paging is enabled.
Docs.value: if custom paging is enabled; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the IsCustomPagingEnabled property to determine whether custom paging is enabled.
> [!NOTE] > Both the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowCustomPaging%2A> properties must be `true` for this property to return `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current page is the first page.
Docs.value: if the current page is the first page; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the IsFirstPage property to determine whether the current page is the first page.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current page is the last page.
Docs.value: if the current page is the last page; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the IsLastPage property to determine whether the current page is the last page.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether paging is enabled.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the IsPagingEnabled property to determine whether paging is enabled.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowPaging%2A> property must be `true` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.PageSize%2A> property cannot be set to 0 for this property to return `true`.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the data source is read-only.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property is implemented to always return `false`, which indicates that the data source can be modified in all cases.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether server-side paging support is enabled.
Docs.value: if paging is enabled and server-side paging is indicated using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging%2A> property; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Server-side paging is enabled when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowPaging%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.AllowServerPaging%2A> properties are both set to `true`, and the amount of data retrieved by the data source cannot be displayed in a single page.

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether access to the data source is synchronized (thread-safe).

remarks.format:
## Remarks This property is derived from the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> class and is overridden to always return `false` to indicate that this class is not thread-safe.
For more information on the IsSynchronized property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the total number of pages necessary to display all items in the data source.
Docs.value: The number of pages necessary to display all items in the data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the PageCount property to determine the number of pages necessary to display all items in the data source.
> [!NOTE] > If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSource%2A> property is `null`, 0 is returned. If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.IsPagingEnabled%2A> property is set to `false` or the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource.DataSourceCount%2A> property is set to 0 or less, 1 is returned.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of items to display on a single page.
Docs.value: The number of items to display on a single page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the PageSize property to specify or determine the number of items to display on a single page.

Docs.summary: Gets the object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The object returned in this implementation is the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PagedDataSource> object itself.
For more information on the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridColumnCollection.SyncRoot%2A> property, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection?displayProperty=fullName> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the virtual number of items in the data source when custom paging is used.
Docs.value: The virtual number of items in the data source when custom paging is used.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the VirtualCount property when custom paging or server-side paging is used to determine the virtual number of items in the data source. For more information on the VirtualCount property, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.VirtualItemCount%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
